description: Construction of a two storey residential building with roof-level accommodation to provide 6 self-contained units with associated amenity space, cycle and refuse storage (following demolition of existing building)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:
Existing Drawings
24-043-E01 - Existing OS Plan
24-043-E02 - Existing Site Plan
24-043-E03 - Existing Ground Floor Plan
24-043-E04 - Existing First Floor Plan
24-043-E05 - Existing Loft Floor Plan
24-043-E06 - Existing Roof Plan
24-043-E07 - Existing Front Elevation (South-facing)
24-043-E08 - Existing Rear Elevation (North-facing)
24-043-E09 - Existing Side Elevation (West-facing)
24-043-E10 - Existing Side Elevation (East-facing)
24-043-E11 - Existing Street Elevation
24-043-E12 - Existing Section A-A
Proposed Drawings
24-043-P01 - Proposed OS Plan
24-043-P02 - Proposed Site Plan
24-043-P03 - Proposed Ground Floor Plan
24-043-P04 - Proposed First Floor Plan
24-043-P05 - Proposed Loft Floor Plan
24-043-P06 - Proposed Roof Plan
24-043-P07 - Proposed Front Elevation (South-facing)
24-043-P08 - Proposed Rear Elevation (North-facing)
24-043-P09 - Proposed Side Elevation (West-facing)
24-043-P10 - Proposed Side Elevation (East-facing)
24-043-P11 - Proposed Street Elevation
24-043-P12 - Proposed A-A

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| Cycle storage for ^IN;  bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development, within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with the designated locations identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and all adopted standards prior to the first occupation of the building. The storage spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the designated location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).

| No operations (including initial site clearance) shall commence on site in connection with development hereby approved until a suitable scheme (Arboricultural Method Statement) for the protection of existing trees and hedgerows has been submitted and its installation on site has been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

All protection measures must fully detail each phase of the development process taking into account demolition/site clearance works, all construction works and hard and soft landscaping works.  Details shall include the following:

o	Tree protection plan of all trees within influencing distance and on adjacent sites in accordance with BS5837*, with tree works proposals.  All trees must be plotted on a site plan**, clearly and accurately depicting trunk locations, root protection areas and canopy spreads.
o	A plan** detailing all trees planned for retention and removal.

o	A schedule of tree works for all the retained trees  specifying pruning and other remedial or preventative work, whether for physiological, hazard abatement, aesthetic or operational reasons.  All tree works must be approved by the tree service and shall be carried out in accordance with BS 3998.

o	Site specific construction specifications (e.g. bridging, instillation of underground services, surfacing, storm water tanks, foundations of all structures and garden walls, within the root protection area,)
o	Site specific demolition and hard surface removal specifications
o	Level changes

o	A Tree protection plan** in accordance with BS5837* detailing all methods of protection, including but not restricted to: locations of construction exclusion zones, root protection areas, fit for purpose fencing and ground protection, service routes, works access space, material/machinery/waste storage and permanent & temporary hard surfaces.
o	Details of the arboricultural supervision schedule.

All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the  site, unless the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority has first been sought and obtained.
*Using the most recent revision the of the Standard
** Plans must be of a minimum scale of 1:200 (unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority)

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.
| The development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with a suitable Tree Monitoring Program.
(a) Prior to the commencement of development (including ground works and site clearance), the following shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority:
A tree monitoring program to include:
o	Confirmation of who shall be the lead arboriculturalist for the development.
o	Confirmation of the Site Manager, key personnel, their key responsibilities and contact details.
o	Details of induction procedures for all personnel in relation to Arboricultural matters.
o	A detailed timetable of events for arboricultural supervision concerning all tree protection measures within the approved Tree Protection Plan, including:
o	Initial implementation/installation of the tree protection measures
o	Timestamped photos throughout the project confirming the protective measures are in place.
o	Approved incursions into construction exclusion zones
o	Excavations for underground services and installation of foundations for structures and garden walls.
o	Final removal of the tree protection measures
o	Procedures for dealing with non-approved incursions into the construction exclusion zones as detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement.
(b) Following details shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Authority Tree Officer:
o	Results of each site visit by the lead arboriculturist with photos attached immediately following each visit.

o	Within three months of first use of the development hereby approved, a report containing the Assessment of the retained and planted trees including any necessary remedial action as a result of damage incurred during construction.

Reason: To ensure appropriate tree protection in the interests of protecting the visual amenity of the area, contributing to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.21 of the London Plan, policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines.

| The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications shall be based on environmental noise levels occurring during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise). Internal and external amenity noise levels shall not exceed the criteria set by BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and Housing SPG 206 and Policy D14 London Plan.

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms below bathrooms of separate flat and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedroom adjoining the communal main entrance/ stairwell. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Plan Document (2023), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), and Policy D14 London Plan.
| Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented during demolition and construction:
- noise and vibration - according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014,
- dust - according to IAQM (2024) Guidance on the assessment of dust from demolition and construction),
- lighting - according to 'Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals,
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policies 1.1 (e) (j) 1.2 (f), 2.1 (c) and 2.10 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies T4, T6, T7, SI1 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), Greater London Authoirty Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part1: Noise.
| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General
Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that
Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration
of the new dwellinghouse other than that expressly authorised by this permission
shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local
planning authority.
Reason: To ensure orderly development, which would not harm the amenities of
the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area ain accordance
with the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), policy 7B and 7.4 of the
Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (g) of the
Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies D3, D4 and D6 of the

London Plan (2021). | Prior to completion of construction and occupation the developer shall submit evidence to the Council that Air Source Heat Pumps have been installed and are fully operational to provide for Space Heating and Domestic Hot Water for the dwellings.

Reason: To ensure a sustainable development is undertaken in accordance with Policies D14, SI1, and SI 7 of the London Plan and Climate and Ecological Emergency Strategy (2021). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within a secure enclosure has been provided in accordance with the designated location identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).
| Notwithstanding the information shown on the approved plans, further details of
the hard and soft landscaping shall be submitted to and approved in writing by
the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. All
detailed works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of the
premises. Such details shall include: the height and materials of the boundary
treatment, the provision of planting in the forecourt and any new surfacing
materials to be used.
Reason: To improve the visual amenity of the property through urban greening
in accordance with policies 5.10 and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management
DPD (2013), policies D8, G4 and G5 of the London Plan (2021) and the National
Planning Policy Framework (2023). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General
Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that
Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement or other alteration
of the new dwellinghouse other than that expressly authorised by this permission
shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local
planning authority.
Reason: To ensure orderly development, which would not harm the amenities of
the occupiers of nearby properties or to the character of the area ain accordance
with the National Planning Policy Framework (2024), policy 7B and 7.4 of the
Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policy 1.1 (g) of the
Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and policies D3, D4 and D6 of the
London Plan (2021).
Notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2 Part 3 Class L of the Town
and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any order
revoking and re-enacting that Order), the residential unit hereby approved shall
at no time be converted from C3 residential to a C4 small HMO, without express
planning permission having first been granted by the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living
conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in
accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management
Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4, and D6 and of the London
Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024). | One bat box for crevice dwelling species or one bird box shall be installed on the main building  prior to occupation.
Reason: To ensure that the biodiversity gain objective is met, in accordance with Schedule 7A of the Town and Country Planning Act (1990) and Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021).
